question: I'm gonna kill this dog! You make my wife talk to me or I'm gonna shoot this fuckin' dog!
answer: No one's going anywhere, L-T. We can talk this guy down. Hey, George? George, don't kill the dog, okay? We don't want to hear a gun go off in there.

question: Fuck you!
answer: Where's the guy's wife? Goddamnit, you said we had her. I told him we had her! Pull the dog's name out of your ass. Get the dog's name. I didn't lie to you, George. You scared your wife pretty good last night. We're having a hard time finding her. You and I have been talking for, what, sixteen hours? Keep talking. Is that your dog, too?

question: I don't know whose dog it is. She lied about everything else, so she probably lied about the dog.
answer: I know you're hurting. You lose your job, you find out your wife's fucking another guy . . . but don't give up. We'll have her talk to you.

question: Then why won't she open her mouth?! Why doesn't the bitch say something???
answer: George? Come back to the window.

question: STOP LOOKING AT ME!!!
answer: George? Leave the dog alone and come to the window. What's the dog's name? Murray!! They're in the house! His wife's in the house!

question: Try to act cool, okay? He's gonna think you're a dick.
answer: Robbing this place is gonna put you back in prison.

question: Not if they don't catch us, Kevin.
answer: We got jobs, man; we're working. Why even take the chance?

question: Because if you don't take the chance, you're already dead. Thirty seconds, we'll be down the road. Thirty seconds. Then we'll go to the movies.
answer: It's perfect.

question: A pack of Marlboros for my friend and all your cash, you gook motherfucker!
answer: He's got a gun!

question: I have his corporate and personal on two disks, labeled Marlon and Al. What, you don't have a sense of humor? He's going to love it.
answer: My stomach is eating me!

question: Yeah, that's Thomas, the human piranha. I have to feed the animals while Pam's in Florida with her sister.
answer: My stomach has teeth! It's eating my guts!

question: Get your ass in the chair! Sit down!
answer: Jen? Are you all right?

question: She'll be dead if you don't put your ass in that chair! Kevin! Don't stand there, asshole, close the windows! Mars, keep him covered, dude!
answer: Who sent you?

question: Don't go Rambo and you'll tell'm about this on the back nine. I'm gonna tie you up, then we're gonna take your car.
answer: The car. All you want is the car?

question: Am I talkin' raghead?! I want your car! Gimme the goddamned keys!
answer: The keys are on the wall by the garage. Take it. The tank's almost full.

question: It's really hard, Jane. This isn't the way I want it.
answer: No? Then whose idea was it for you take a job in the middle of nowhere?

question: I need to work out some stuff.
answer: You're hiding, Jeffrey. You're hiding from the job and you're hiding from me.

question: I still see that boy's eyes.
answer: That happened a year ago. You've been gone for almost six months. How long do you have to punish yourself for something that wasn't your fault?

question: Is Amanda there?
answer: It's Dad. He wants to speak with you. She has to go to the bathroom. You're not only punishing yourself, Jeff. Amanda and I are in this, too.

question: Can we talk some more when you get here?
answer: We'll see you in a couple of hours. Pack your things. You're going.

question: Mike's been shot! Someone shot Junior Kim, too --
answer: What are you talking about, shot? What happened?

question: Three white males shot Junior. Mike followed them to York Estates --
answer: Where are they?

question: York Estates. Four-five-five Castle Way. Anders and Jorgenson are on the way.
answer: Sonofabitch.

question: Sonofabitch.
answer: Welch is down! They shot him!

question: Are civilians inside? Holster your guns! Mike! Mike, can you hear me?
answer: I think he's dead!

question: Don't shout, Larry. I'm three feet away. We have to cordon off the streets, then evacuate these houses. Keep your head down. How you doing, buddy? You still alive? Jesus. You hang on. He's in the backseat! This is Talley. Who's on? One at a time! Clear the air! Louise? Talk to me. What do we have?
answer: Junior Kim was DOA at the hospital.

question: Quiet! I want radio discipline. Mike's hanging in. Larry, Jorgy? Listen up. Find out who lives at four-five-five. We gotta know who's in there.
answer: Chief? Mike said a young girl answered the door.

question: Did he say if she was shooting at him?
answer: He didn't say.

question: Then we don't know if she's part of this or not. Mickey, you up?
answer: We're out two minutes, me and Dreyer.

question: Mike found a red pickup abandoned on Flanders. You see it?
answer: It's right in front of us.

question: Run a DMV on the plate for the owner's name.
answer: I pulled Mickey and Dreyer off the minimart.

question: Jesus Christ, Louise, we can't leave a crime scene like that. Put a unit out there.
answer: We only have eight officers on duty, Chief.

question: Shut up! Shut the fuck up!
answer: None of you will get out of this.

question: Stay down! Stay down, goddamnit!
answer: I'm going to my desk.

question: Take it easy, son. I'm only going to my desk.
answer: Get on the floor!

question: I have contacts in Los Angeles. Lawyers and judges who can help you.
answer: I'll fuckin' kill you!

question: This is every criminal lawyer in California. If you give up now, right now, I'll buy you the best lawyer in the state.
answer: We just killed a cop! We killed a fat chinaman! We'll get the death penalty! Mars, watch the cops! Kevin! Watch the back of the house!

question: You won't die if you let me help.
answer: Bullshit!

question: But if you stay in this house, I can promise you this --
answer: Shut up! Shut up and get on the floor!

question: Get a phone number for the Smiths.
answer: Chief, Mikkelson.

question: Go, Mickey.
answer: The truck is registered to Dennis James Rooney, white male, twenty-two. He has an Agua Dulce address.

question: Hello?
answer: My name is Jeff Talley. Is this Dennis Rooney?

question: You with the cops?
answer: The Bristo Police Department. Look out the window. You see the car?

question: Yeah. I'm Rooney.
answer: We had an awful lot of shooting. You need a doctor in there?

question: We're cool.
answer: Let me speak to Mr. Smith. I want to hear it from him.

question: Fuck you. I'm running this shit. You talk to me.
answer: How about your two friends? You don't have a man dying in there, do you?

question: They're fine.
answer: All three subjects are confirmed inside. Call off the house-to-house. Okay, Dennis, I want to explain your situation --

question: You don't have to explain shit! That Chinaman pulled a gun. We wrestled for it. That Chinaman shot himself.
answer: Mr. Kim didn't make it, Dennis. He died.

question: How about the cop?
answer: Dennis? I want you to release those people.

question: Fuck that. They're the only thing stopping you from blowing us away.
answer: We're not coming in there by force, okay? No one wants to hurt you.

question: I got these people! You try to come get me, I'll kill every fuckin' one of them! That fuckin' Chinaman is dead! That's murder-one, dude. That's the needle! Get back where you belong, asshole! Mars, keep and eye on the cops; I gotta find a way out of here --
answer: I have to tell you something --

question: We gotta find a way outta here is what we gotta do!
answer: It's about Mars -- That cop didn't pull his gun. Mars lied. He just started shooting!

question: Bullshit. Why would Mars do that?
answer: I was there, Dennis! I saw! It's like he wanted to shoot that cop.

question: You're being stupid. Check out the bathroom. Maybe we can sneak out a window -- Kev.
answer: Jesus. What is this?

question: Are you totally stupid? What does it look like? Look, that's the master bedroom out here.
answer: I can see you!

question: Dude, this is solid steel. They gotta be hiding something.
answer: Dennis --

question: Just around the corner and up that street. See the helicopters?
answer: Wait by the car, Mandy. Give me a minute with Dad.

question: I should've called. This thing broke right after we spoke, then everything happened so fast --
answer: Don't worry about it. How are you doing?

question: The Sheriffs will take over when they get here.
answer: But they're not here yet. Tell me about you. Jesus, you're shaking.

question: Why don't you guys grab some dinner at the Thai place? I'll meet you there as soon as I can.
answer: You sure?

question: I don't know how long I'll be stuck here.
answer: I'm in no rush. Maybe later we can talk.

question: Jane? I'm scared shitless.
answer: That's okay. I love you anyway.

question: No way. I tell them, that Old Man is gonna handle this from back there.
answer: You should warn them, Sonny.

question: Fuck them! Now get your head in the game, Phil--we have to handle this. Put our people on the scene. Smith might talk just to cut a break for his kids.
answer: He knows better than that.

question: L.A. County Sheriffs are inbound from a bank robbery in Pico Rivera.
answer: Give me an ETA.

question: An hour, tops. Might be sooner. A command team, a negotiating team, a tactical team--the tac team includes a perimeter team, the assault team, snipers, and breachers--thirty-five new bodies.
answer: How many locals? And Talley? Good work, Gayle--everybody. Now stay ahead of the curve. I want to know everything that happens before it happens. I'll cover Talley.

question: What if it goes south?
answer: What do you mean?

question: If things get wet, we're going to need someone who can handle that end.
answer: You worry about your end. I got my side covered. Talley lives here. I don't know if the place has security or not.

question: You worry about your end. I got my side covered. Talley lives here. I don't know if the place has security or not.
answer: It won't be a problem.

question: He has a wife and kid. That's how we'll get to him.
answer: Okey-doke.

question: We have to own this guy, Marion. We don't want him dead; we need to use him.
answer: Can we make him dead after we use him?

question: Whatever you want. Page me when you're done. Donuts here any good?
answer: I don't eat junk food.

question: Louise?
answer: Go, Chief.

question: Call Jane for me. She's at the little Thai place.
answer: I know the one.

question: There's gotta be a million bucks here. Maybe two million!
answer: It's a safety room. If anyone breaks into your house, you can hide.

question: Who gives a shit, Mars? Check out the cash! We're rich.
answer: We're trapped in a house.

question: We can take it with us.
answer: You can't run with suitcases.

question: Jesus, first Mars, now you. You two need anti-depressants.
answer: My father needs a doctor. Please.

question: Hey, I've got a situation here, in case you haven't noticed.
answer: All you're doing is watching yourself on TV. Look at him.

question: Use more ice.
answer: I'm getting a doctor!

question: We should tie them. We can put them upstairs out of the way.
answer: That's right. That's a good idea, Mars.

question: Find something
answer: Find something, Kevin. Don't just stand there. And tie this bastard, too. I don't want him waking up and goin' Rambo on us.

question: Here. Put this on. You gotta pee?
answer: I don't see why you can't just lock me in. It's not like I can go anywhere.

question: Either I'm going to tie you or Mars will tie you. Which do you want?
answer: Thanks for the shirt.

question: Whatever.
answer: Kevin, my father needs a doctor.

question: He's just knocked out. I've been knocked out.
answer: If my father dies they'll charge you with his murder. Can't you make Dennis see that?

question: Jen! Sit still! If they're in the security room, they can see you on the monitors. I figured out what these cameras can see last year when Mom and Dad went to Lake Arrowhead. It can't see me over here, but it's looking at you, so don't move!
answer: Ow! Shit!

question: Be quiet! Listen!
answer: No one's coming.

question: That big asshole nailed my windows.
answer: Mine, too.

question: We can use the crawlspace to get downstairs. Then we can run for it.
answer: No! I'm not going to leave Daddy with them!

question: We can't carry him.
answer: You go, Thomas. You get out, and I'll stay with Daddy.

question: I'm not gonna leave you!
answer: Go! If you get out, maybe you can help the police!

question: We'll all go, Jennifer. All of us or none of us. I know where Daddy keeps a gun.
answer: You leave that gun alone!

question: Shh, they'll hear you!
answer: Better than you getting killed! Don't touch that gun! Daddy says --

question: Do it.
answer: Don't crowd the house. The alpha's a kid named Rooney. He's amped up and volatile.

question: Sounds like you know the job.
answer: I've done it once or twice. I blocked their phones to incoming calls, so you'll have to cut in a hard line to talk to him.

question: Someone should stay with Mr. Smith. What if he wakes up?
answer: That's why we tied him, dumbass. Now come here and see this -- These bushes follow the wall into the neighbor's yard. All we need is some kind of diversion and we're home free.

question: That's crazy, Dennis. The cops will see us.
answer: Not if they're looking at something else.

question: Look out the window, Dennis. We are NOT entering the house. We're pulling back.
answer: You fuck! I got a fuckin' gun to this kid's head! I'll kill'm, you fuck!

question: It's over now, Dennis! Don't hurt anyone.
answer: We'll burn this fuckin' place down! I got gasoline all over in here!

question: No one's coming in. A couple of guys out here got carried away.
answer: Goddamned right they got carried away. It looks like an army out there.

question: It's over. He's cooling off.
answer: Talley?

question: I'm here.
answer: I want a helicopter to take us to Mexico.

question: That's not going to happen, Dennis. They won't give you a helicopter.
answer: I'll give you these people.

question: The Mexican police would arrest you as soon as it landed. There's only one way out and you're doing it right now--just keep talking to us. I think we could make the transition now. Maddox, you good to go? Hey, Dennis? Can I let you in on a personal secret?
answer: What?

question: I gotta piss real bad.
answer: You're a funny guy, Talley.

question: I'm going to put on an officer named Will Maddox. You talk to him for a while. He says he has gasoline set to burn the place.
answer: Jesus. He must've siphoned it from the cars.

question: If you go in, you can't use tear gas or flashbangs. The whole place would go up.
answer: Looks like you're bailing out at the right time.

question: That's why you get the big bucks, Captain.
answer: Chief, base.

question: Go.
answer: I couldn't find Jane. She wasn't at the restaurant.

question: You have her cell number?
answer: She didn't answer.

question: Chief, base.
answer: Did you find Jane and Mandy?

question: Could you call me back on your phone? Right away.
answer: What's wrong with the radio?

question: Other people can hear us. Just call. Please.
answer: Stand by. Is something wrong with Jane?

question: Stand by. Is something wrong with Jane?
answer: We have a boy on the line. He says he's Thomas Smith and he's calling from the house.

question: It's a crank, Louise. C'mon, don't waste my time with that!
answer: His cell number belongs to the Smiths. I think it's real, Chief. I think this boy is inside that house.

question: Put him on. Get Martin. Right away. This is Chief Talley. Tell me your name, son.
answer: Thomas Smith. I'm in the house that's on TV. Dennis hit my dad and now he won't wake up. You gotta help him.

question: Slow down, Thomas. Take it easy and talk to me. Was your father shot?
answer: Dennis hit him. His head's all big and he won't wake up. I'm really scared.

question: How about you and your sister?
answer: We're okay.

question: Where are you right now?
answer: In my room.

question: That's on the second floor. Could you climb out your window if we were downstairs to catch you?
answer: They nailed the windows. I can't get'm open.

question: I've got the boy on the phone. He's using a cell phone. What was that, son? I didn't hear you.
answer: If I try to climb out they'll see me on the security cameras. They would see you outside, too -- They're coming!

question: Thomas? Thomas...? He says that his father's hurt.
answer: If we have a man dying in there, we'll have to go in.

question: They have security cameras. Rooney would see you coming.
answer: Did the boy say that any of them are in immediate danger?

question: No. He said that his father's unconscious; he didn't say he was dying.
answer: Then I think we should wait. Do you agree?

question: You want me to stick around, I could --
answer: You've been here all day, Chief. Take a break. See your family. If I need you, I'll call.

question: Do you see the fuckin' gun?! Look at it!
answer: Take it easy.

question: Where's your gun?
answer: I'm the Chief. I don't carry it. Who are you?

question: Follow the Mustang. We won't go far. I know you're scared, but unless you do something stupid we're not going to hurt you. You understand? Don't just fuckin' sit there, dumbass. Do you understand?
answer: What do you want?

question: These guys are going to take hold of you. Don't freak out. It's for your own good.
answer: What is this?

question: Say hello. I know, I know--she's all right. Your kid's all right, too. C'mon, now, relax. From this point on, you control what happens to them. Can we let go? You past your shock and all that, we can turn you loose and you won't do something stupid?
answer: You can let go.

question: Here's the deal--Walter Smith has two computer disks like this in his house. They're labeled 'Marlon' and 'Al.'
answer: Marlon and Al....

question: We want them. You will not let anyone go into that house--or anything come out-- until my people recover these disks.
answer: I can't control what happens. The Sheriffs are running the scene.

question: You will re-assume command. In two hours, a group of my people will arrive at York Estates. You will tell the Sheriffs that they are an FBI tactical team. When this phone rings, you answer. It will be me. I'll tell you what to do. When I have what I want, you get your family.
answer: You want . . . Marlon and Al.

question: I have people in York Estates right under your nose. If you do anything except what I'm telling you, you'll get Jane and Amanda back in the mail. We clear on that?
answer: These disks . . . where are they?

question: I'm going back to York. Have Larry meet me at the front gate.
answer: What's up, Chief? Did I do something wrong?

question: I want you to run this license plate and phone number. Then I want you to find out everything you can about Walter Smith.
answer: The guy in the house?

question: Go back to the office. Run his name through the FBI and the NLETS database. I think he's involved with illegal activity or he associates with people who are.
answer: Wow. Sure, right away, Chief.

question: Don't tell anyone what you're doing, not Louise, not the other guys, not the Sheriffs. You understand me, Larry?
answer: I guess so.

question: Fuck guessing. You keep your mouth shut.
answer: I will, Chief. Absolutely.

question: Thomas? Thomas, is that you? What do you want?
answer: We can't make the microwave work.

question: What?
answer: We're hungry. You're going to cook. Make the pizza. I want scrambled eggs and hot dogs on mine.

question: How about dog shit?
answer: With hot sauce and butter.

question: I changed my mind. That's all you need to know.
answer: That you, Talley?

question: The one and only. We got a little problem out here, Dennis.
answer: You oughta try on the problem I got in here.

question: I need you to let me talk to Mr. Smith.
answer: We been through that. Forget it.

question: They better not!
answer: Help me keep them out! Let me speak to Smith, Dennis. Let me speak to him right now.

question: SHIT!!!!
answer: Talk to me, Dennis. Help me help you. Why can't you put Smith on the phone?

question: He got knocked out. It's like he's sleeping. He just lays there.
answer: Now I understand. That helps. I can make them understand that.

question: Okay.
answer: Let me come get him.

question: Fuck that! You bastards will jump me!
answer: If you won't let me come in, then put him outside.

question: You'll cap my ass as soon as I step out the door!
answer: You've already helped yourself once, Dennis; be smart again. If you save his life, it'll help when you get to court.

question: Fuck you, Talley, fuck you! You and one other guy, but that's it! I want you stripped! I gotta know you don't have guns!
answer: Bring up the ambulance. Okay, Dennis, we won't approach the house until you've closed the door. Easy.... Let's do it. How's he look?

question: No. I'm the chief of police here. I have to talk to him.
answer: Ain't gonna happen. We've got unequal pupilation. He could have an intracranial hematoma or a fracture or both.

question: Smith! Wake up!
answer: What are you doing?! Stop that!

question: Wake up, goddamnit. Who are you?
answer: This man needs a hospital! Stop it!

question: Use smelling salts, give him a shot, whatever. I just need a minute. Stop the fuckin' engine!
answer: I'm not going to wake him. I don't even know that I can.

question: Just one question. Please.
answer: He. Can't. Answer.

question: Was Smith talking?
answer: I heard he's fucked up. They're taking him to the hospital.

question: Goddamnit, tell me what you know. Did the cops go in? Did Smith have the disks?
answer: I don't know. Talley talked those punks into letting Smith out. He's fucking us over, Glen. That guy is fucking us over.

question: What hospital?
answer: Canyon Country.

question: Put him on.
answer: Is my daddy okay?

question: The doctors are taking care of him right now. Thomas . . . are you safe? Can you talk?
answer: I think so.

question: I need your help with something. But if you think those guys could catch you, then I don't want you to do it, okay?
answer: Okay.

question: I'm serious, Thomas; I don't want you to get hurt.
answer: What do you want me to do?

question: Your dad has two computer disks. They have funny names
answer: He has lots of disks.

question: I think he was working on them today, so they're probably in his office. Could you find them and see who they belong to?
answer: Dennis won't let me go to the desk. He makes me sit on the floor. But I might be able to sneak into the office if they're not around. Then I could open the disks here in my room.

question: I thought they locked you in your room.
answer: I can get into the crawlspace from my closet and climb all over the house.

question: Can you get into the office?
answer: I can get into the den. The office is right across the hall.

question: If I get Rooney into the back of the house, can you find the disks without being caught?
answer: Yes, sir.

question: I want to know what in hell you're doing.
answer: I'm looking for you. I need your tactical unit.

question: I'm not stupid! You can't get out of here fast enough, then you take back command; you agree to wait on Smith, then you risk everything in a stupid stunt to get him out --
answer: Don't question me, Captain! This is my crime scene!

question: -- then when you get him, you damn near assault the man in the ambulance! What is going on?
answer: I'm a negotiator, Captain. I negotiate. That's all you need to know. Now are you going to help me or not?

question: Keep the change, m'man.
answer: We're fucked.

question: We're fucked until we think of a way out; then we're rich.
answer: There is no way out.

question: For chrissake, please! Help me celebrate! I figured it out!
answer: Celebrate what? Going to prison?

question: Mars! They're trying to blindside us! Check the front!
answer: Come on, Dennis. Talk to me. I'm unarmed. I'm looking at you. Get out here and let's talk.

question: You got a sniper out there, gonna shoot me?
answer: Only if you try to grab me. We could've shot you from the wall. You've been in there a long time. What're you waiting for?

question: Would you be in a hurry to go to prison for the rest of your life?
answer: I'd be trying to get the best deal that I could.

question: Maybe that's what I'm doing. Can I reach in my pocket, show you something? That's fifty hundred-dollar bills. Five grand. They got money in this house, Talley, more than you've ever seen. How much would it be worth to you, getting me out of here?
answer: You picked a bad house to hole up in, son.

question: Two hundred thousand cash, right in your pocket, no one needs to know.
answer: Give up.

question: There's a million dollars in there, maybe two million. I'll give you half.
answer: The man you sent to the hospital is a criminal. He has partners. This is their house and their money and they want it back.

question: It ain't been a good day, Chief.
answer: Give up, Dennis. Let these people go. At least you'll have your life.

question: Give up, Dennis. Let these people go. At least you'll have your life.
answer: I got'm!

question: Can you open them?
answer: I opened Marlon. I think it's somebody's taxes.

question: Look for names. Does it say whose taxes they are?
answer: I don't see any people names. It's all businesses.

question: Try Al. See if you can open Al.
answer: Yeah! Here's a name. This is somebody's personal tax --

question: Who is it?
answer: Charles G. Benza. They're coming!

question: Another minute. Please --
answer: You dumb fuckwad cop, you fucked up bad!

question: Do you think I'm going to let you murder someone?!
answer: You want a blowtorch on your daughter's pretty face?!

question: I'll go in that fuckin' house right now! I'll give those disks to the real FBI, you COCKSUCKINGMOTHERFUCKER!! And I've got Smith! I've got Smith!!
answer: I guess we each have something the other wants.

question: I guess we do.
answer: My people are good to go. You know who I mean?

question: Your phony FBI assholes.
answer: We're almost home, you and me. Keep your shit together. This isn't L.A.

question: What do you mean by that?
answer: You don't want another dead child on your conscience.

question: I shouldn't have told him about the money. Now Talley is gonna keep it for himself.
answer: He said that?

question: If we don't escape, we gotta get the word out about the cash. That's how we'll stay alive.
answer: What are you talking about?

question: The only way he can keep the cash is if nobody knows about it. He's gotta cap all three of us before they even read our rights. He's probably planning it right now.
answer: That's crazy. He's not going to kill us.

question: Kevin, you're so fuckin' stupid...
answer: It's over. We have to give up.

question: Fuck it's over. That money's mine.
answer: That money's fucked up your brain. Talley's going to get tired of waiting for us to give up, and we'll all be fuckin' killed!

question: Then we might as well die rich.
answer: I'm not going to die for this!

question: What do you want?
answer: Keep your voice down. I'm taking you and your brother out of here.

question: What happened?
answer: Do you want to go or not? I'm offering you a way out of here.

question: I can't go without Thomas.
answer: All three of us will go, but we have to move fast. Mars and Dennis don't know I'm doing this.

question: How can we get out?
answer: Dennis and Mars are in the den. I'll get your brother, then come back for you. We'll go down the stairs and out the front door, you understand?

question: Yes.
answer: Put on some shoes. You scared the shit out of me. I was looking for you. Dennis wants you to watch the monitors.

question: They here now? Yeah.
answer: Let me see some ID. Something with a picture. I don't give a shit about your badge. Okay, here's mine. My name is Special Agent Jones.

question: Are all of you named Jones?
answer: Don't be funny, Chief. You can't afford it. In a few minutes the white phone is going to ring. So let's get our shit straight before that happens.

question: You used to be a cop. All of you used to be cops. I can tell by the way you move.
answer: Don't worry about what we used to be.

question: How do you people expect this to work? The Sheriffs have a Crisis Response Team here.
answer: What's my name?

question: What?
answer: I asked you my name. You just saw my commission slip. What's my fucking name?

question: Special Agent Jones.
answer: Think of me that way and you won't fuck up. I'll handle the Sheriffs.

question: What are you people going to do?
answer: You and I are gonna straighten this out with the Sheriffs, and then we'll wait for the man to call. When he gives the word, we move.

question: What does he have on you? I know why I'm doing this, but what does he have on you?
answer: Let's go, Chief. Time to get real.

question: Krupchek lives in a shithole.
answer: I guess we could jimmy it.

question: I don't want to pay for breaking it.
answer: Christ, that stinks.

question: Mickey? Look at this shit. He's burned them.
answer: What?

question: He burned their noses.
answer: Okay, this is creeping me out.

question: What are those, rats?
answer: Ohmigod. We gotta call Talley.

question: Kev? Key, Kevin, c'mon back. I'm sorry I hit you. C'mon, Kev, don't fuckin' pout! You're right. It's time to call it a game. You mean he left, as in went out the front door?
answer: I overheard him with the girl.

question: Shit! That fuck! Even when I want to turn myself in he screws it up! Did he take the kids with him?
answer: I don't know.

question: Jesus, get upstairs and find out! If he took those kids, we're fucked! KEVIN!!! You ASSHOLE!!!
answer: Kevin left without you.

question: Kevin left without you.
answer: I don't know what you're talking about. Don't do that. Turn on the lights. You'd better get out of here! Kevin's coming back!

question: Kevin's gone, your daddy's gone, everybody's gone. Now we can do whatever we want.
answer: Stop it.

question: We've got to get those kids out of there!
answer: Not until the man calls.

question: Those kids are in there with a fucking psychopath! He kills people!
answer: They've been in there all day.

question: Talley. You do what you have to do; I'm getting those kids.
answer: Talley! We'll secure the house, but then we get the disks. Go --

question: The kids are in here!
answer: Where's the office?

question: Help me, goddamnit, we can get the disks later!
answer: We don't need you any more, Chief. We can get the disks on our own.

question: You guys step out for a second. I have to talk to the Chief. Did you find the disks?
answer: Yes.

question: Then you have everything. You can put them away.
answer: A man has my family. Gold watch here. Dark tan.

question: That would be Glen Howell. He was on his way for the disks.
answer: How do I reach him? Two words

question: How do I reach him? Two words
answer: How did you get this number?

question: Mr. Jones is dead. So are two of his men. The other three are in jail. I have the disks. I have Walter Smith. And you know what, you motherfucker? I have you.
answer: I have your fucking family. Don't forget that.

question: I also have a couple of million in cash. Call Sonny Benza. Ask if I can keep it.
answer: What do you want?

question: My wife and my daughter and the money. I'll bring the disks to the mall by the freeway, you bring my family. We'll trade.
answer: Fuck that! You think I'm crazy?!

question: I think you got no choice.
answer: Fuck the mall. You know that motel on the road west of town?

question: Yeah.
answer: You got ten minutes. If you're one minute late, we won't be here to find.

question: The house is in flames, Benza's accountant is with the cops, and they're stacking the bodies like cordwood.
answer: Jesus Christ, it's a clusterfuck.

question: You wanted to let Sonny handle it. I would've moved in when we first found out.
answer: And by doing so, he would've known we have spies in his organization.

question: Yes, sir. But what about the disks? If the cops end up with the disks, we're gonna see a whole lot of heat.
answer: I hate that Mickey Mouse bastard. I hated his father, and I hate Sonny, too. Always with the tan.

question: What do you want to do?
answer: Our people out there, they good people? People in the right place?

question: The best.
answer: Sonny's a fuckup. If he pulls this off, fine--life goes on. But if the cops end up with those disks, we cut our losses.

question: I understand.
answer: I want a message sent

question: Keep your eyes open. He should've been here.
answer: Police!

question: Don't shoot! Don't shoot him!
answer: Where's my family?! Where's my family, you fuck?!

question: Take it easy. Just take it easy. We're here to do business.
answer: You said they would be here, goddamnit! Where are they?

question: They're close. Let me make a call. You can see they're okay.
answer: You said they would be here!

question: Put on the woman.
answer: Jane?

question: You have the disks?
answer: You get the other one when I have my girls. Not talk to them; have them.

question: Where is it?
answer: Close.

question: I have to see if it's real. All right. Now the second one.
answer: First my girls. I get my girls, you get the other disk.

question: Bring them. Stop the car outside the room, but don't get out. Aim your gun at the woman's head. If he doesn't give me the disk, kill her.
answer: I'll kill you! You won't get the other disk!

question: If you shoot me, he'll kill your daughter. Do you want to lose both of them? The negotiation is over, Talley. I won. Now give me the disk or he'll put her brain on the glass.
answer: I love you. I gave the other one to the Sheriffs and they're giving it to the real FBI. This one's a fake.

question: You'd better be kidding.
answer: I'm a cop, you asshole! What did you expect me to do? Pretend all this never happened? Benza's over. You're over. I just want to take my family home.
